snippet: The huge water project built a generation ago to protect the fast-growing state against drought cut off all water to farmers today as a result of the worst drought in California history.   While not entirely unexpected, the move is a brutal blow t...
lead_paragraph: The huge water project built a generation ago to protect the fast-growing state against drought cut off all water to farmers today as a result of the worst drought in California history. While not entirely unexpected, the move is a brutal blow to California's agricultural industry, the nation's largest, with economic conquences far worse than the December freeze.

headline.main: Drought Forces Cutoff of Water To Vast Farmlands in California

byline.original: By ROBERT REINHOLD, Special to The New York Times
